attributes.action: Refuse to make mandatory the addition of folic acid to flour and bread as advised by the Food Standards Agency
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Food Standards Agency is advising the government yet again that folic acid should be added to our bread on a mandatory basis, despite this previous advice on their own website "Unless you are pregnant or thinking of having a baby, you should be able to get all the folate you need by eating a varied and balanced diet." (see link http://www.eatwell.gov.uk/healthydiet/nutritionessentials/vitaminsandminerals/folicacid/) They have now changed this advice. Why? For more information on the risks of ingesting synthetically produced folic acid check the Institute of Food Research article on http://www.ifr.ac.uk/media/Newsreleases/071030folic_acid_fortification.html. 

Please sign and stop this request for mass medication becoming law.
